content: माया [मा-यः बा° नेत्वम्] {@--1@} Deceit, fraud, trick, trickery; a device, an artifice; <ls>Pt. 1. 359.</ls> {@--2@} Jugglery, witchcraft, enchantment, an illusion of magic; स्वप्नो नु माया नु मतिभ्रमो नु <ls>Ś. 6. 9.</ls> {@--3@} (Hence) An unreal or illusory image, a phantom, illusion, unreal apparition; मायां मयोद्भाव्य परीक्षितोऽसि <ls>R. 2. 62</ls>; विकृतिः किन्नु भवेदियं नु माया <ls>Ki. 13. 4</ls>, <ls>R. 12. 74</ls>; <ab>oft.</ab> as the first member of <ab>comp.</ab> in the sense of ‘false’, ‘phantom’, ‘illusory’; {%<ab>e. g.</ab>%} मायावचनं false words; मायामृग &c. {@--4@} A political trick or artifice, diplomatic feat. {@--5@} (In Vedānta <ab>phil.</ab>) Unreality, the illusion by virtue of which one considers the unreal universe as really existent and as distinct from the Supreme Spirit. {@--6@} (In Sān. <ab>phil.</ab>) The Pradhāna or Prakṛti. {@--7@} Wickedness. {@--8@} Pity, compassion. {@--9@} <ab>N.</ab> of the mother of Buddha. {@--10@} <ab>Ved.</ab> Extraordinary power, wisdom (प्रज्ञा). {@--11@} (With Śaivas) One of the four snares (पाश) which entangle the soul. {@--12@} <ab>N.</ab> of the city Gayā. {@--13@} <ab>N.</ab> of Lakṣmī.
